title: Intrinsic and extrinsic motivation Likert Scale

content.question:
A high school is looking to determine if students are motivated to do well in school for internal or external reasons. Fifty students are randomly selected from the school and given a twenty-question survey. The questions are written as statements and students respond on a scale of 1-5 where 1 means “never me” and 5 means “always me.” Half of the questions are from an intrinsic perspective, and the other half from an extrinsic perspective.
Which of the following best describes the data collected for this study?

choices.label: Observational, because they are watching the students respond to the questions.
Correlational, because results will be compared to data gathered from other schools.
Qualitative, because the researchers are using a structured interview with each participant.
Quantitative, because the survey questions involve a Likert scale.

content.answer: Quantitative, because the survey questions involve a Likert scale.

skill.text: 2.C: Evaluate the appropriate use of research design elements in non-experimental methodologies.
